channel.title: Comments on: Printing Woes
channel.description: Scattered pages from an apocryphal diary

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description:
Your experience might be different with the card printing side of the business. Marc's initial run of Rocket Yard looked pretty good, though he mentioned they messed up his latest batch. Also, I had a look at Misery Bubblegum, another card game they printed and it looked pretty good.
Maybe just avoid using red in the graphics. I hear they have some trouble with that color.
item.content:encoded:
Your experience might be different with the card printing side of the business. Marc’s initial run of Rocket Yard looked pretty good, though he mentioned they messed up his latest batch. Also, I had a look at Misery Bubblegum, another card game they printed and it looked pretty good.

Maybe just avoid using red in the graphics. I hear they have some trouble with that color.

item.title: By: Jonathan Leistiko
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Leistiko
item.description:
Wow. That's really, really disappointing. Jeremy and I were seriously considering using Guild of Blades for the FATE card decks for our upcoming release of Inevitable, but this story really doesn't inspire confidence.
I may give them one test run with a ten-deck order - just to see - but I'm inclined to take my business elsewhere simply as a gesture of solidarity.
Thanks for sharing your experience, Andre. I'm sorry that it happened to you.
item.content:encoded:
Wow. That’s really, really disappointing. Jeremy and I were seriously considering using Guild of Blades for the FATE card decks for our upcoming release of Inevitable, but this story really doesn’t inspire confidence.

I may give them one test run with a ten-deck order – just to see – but I’m inclined to take my business elsewhere simply as a gesture of solidarity.

Thanks for sharing your experience, Andre. I’m sorry that it happened to you.
